title: Benjamin Netanyahu says defence minister will remain in post despite sacking
description: The Israeli Prime Minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, has said his defence minister will remain in post, despite being sacked two weeks ago.

title: Rescue attempt underway to save 1,200 aboard two boats trying to cross Mediterranean
description: The Italian coastguard is working to rescue 1,200 people aboard two boats at sea which have got into trouble.

title: Charles Leclerc asks fans to stop showing up at his house
description: Formula One driver Charles Leclerc has asked fans to stay away from his apartment, saying "I won't be coming downstairs if you visit my home".

title: President Biden 'planning on running' in 2024 US election - but won't 'announce it yet'
description: President Joe Biden has appeared to confirm that he will run for re-election in 2024.

title: Mother of British-Israeli sisters killed in West Bank attack dies
description: The mother of two British-Israeli sisters who were killed last week in a shooting attack in the West Bank has died of her wounds, hospital officials said on Monday.

title: Six killed in French Alps avalanche
description: French search and rescue teams have found a sixth body following an avalanche on Sunday.

title: Berlusconi showing 'steady improvement' during treatment, doctors say
description: Former Italian prime minister Silvio Berlusconi is showing "steady improvement" during his treatment for a lung infection, his doctors have said.

title: Murderer who faked his own death to escape prison arrested
description: A murderer who faked his own death to escape prison has been arrested in Tanzania - almost a year after a fire that was supposed to have killed him.

title: Dalai Lama apologises after kissing boy and asking him to 'suck my tongue'
description: The Dalai Lama has apologised after footage emerged showing him kissing a young boy on the lips and asking him to "suck my tongue".

title: 'This one is for Seve': Spain's Jon Rahm pays tribute to hero after second Masters win
description: Spain's Jon Rahm has won the 87th Masters at Augusta National.
